Learn how to install and use DuskMoon Elements in your project

# Getting Started DuskMoon Elements is a web components library that bridges the `@duskmoon-dev/core` design system to real-world projects. It provides framework-agnostic, reusable UI components built with native Web Components APIs. ## Installation ### Install the complete package ```bash npm install @duskmoon-dev/elements ``` ### Or install individual components ```bash npm install @duskmoon-dev/el-button @duskmoon-dev/el-card ``` ### Install the design system (required) ```bash npm install @duskmoon-dev/core ``` ## Basic Usage ### 1. Import the design system styles Add the theme styles to your HTML or CSS: ```html ``` Or in your CSS/SCSS: ```css @import '@duskmoon-dev/core/dist/moonlight.css'; ``` ### 2. Register the components You can register all components at once: ```javascript import '@duskmoon-dev/elements/register'; ``` Or register individual components: ```javascript import '@duskmoon-dev/el-button/register'; import '@duskmoon-dev/el-card/register'; ``` ### 3. Use the components ```html Click me

Card Title

Card content goes here.

 ``` ## Theme Support DuskMoon Elements supports two themes from `@duskmoon-dev/core`: - **Moonlight** (dark theme) - **Sunshine** (light theme) Switch themes by changing the `data-theme` attribute on your HTML element: ```html ``` ## Framework Integration ### Vanilla JavaScript ```html Click me ``` ### React ```tsx import '@duskmoon-dev/el-button/register'; function App() { return ( alert('Clicked!')}> Click me ); } ``` ### Vue ```vue ``` ## Browser Support DuskMoon Elements supports all modern browsers: - Chrome/Edge 84+ - Firefox 101+ - Safari 16.4+ ## Next Steps - Explore the [Button](/duskmoon-elements/docs/components/button) component - Learn about [Theming](/duskmoon-elements/docs/theming) - Browse all [Components](/duskmoon-elements/docs/components/button)

Action
``` ## CSS Custom Properties | Property | Default | Description | |----------|---------|-------------| | `--card-padding` | `1rem` | Internal padding | | `--card-border-radius` | `0.5rem` | Border radius | | `--card-shadow` | `0 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,0.12)` | Box shadow for elevated variant | | `--card-border-color` | `var(--color-outline)` | Border color for outlined variant | | `--card-background` | `var(--color-surface)` | Background color | ## Accessibility - Use semantic HTML elements inside the card - Provide meaningful headings for screen readers - If interactive, ensure keyboard navigation works properly
Text input component with validation and various states

import ComponentDemo from '../../../components/ComponentDemo.astro'; # Input The Input component provides a styled text input with support for validation, labels, and helper text. ## Installation ```bash npm install @duskmoon-dev/el-input ``` ## Usage ```javascript import '@duskmoon-dev/el-input/register'; ``` ```html ``` ## Live Demo
## Properties | Property | Type | Default | Description | |----------|------|---------|-------------| | `value` | `string` | `''` | Input value | | `label` | `string` | `''` | Label text | | `placeholder` | `string` | `''` | Placeholder text | | `type` | `'text' \| 'email' \| 'password' \| 'number' \| 'tel' \| 'url'` | `'text'` | Input type | | `disabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Disables the input | | `readonly` | `boolean` | `false` | Makes input read-only | | `required` | `boolean` | `false` | Marks as required | | `error` | `string` | `''` | Error message to display | | `helper` | `string` | `''` | Helper text below input | ## Basic Examples ### With Label ```html ``` ### With Helper Text ```html ``` ### With Error ```html ``` ## Input Types ### Text ```html ``` ### Email ```html ``` ### Password ```html ``` ### Number ```html ``` ## States ### Disabled ```html ``` ### Read-only ```html ``` ### Required ```html ``` ## Events | Event | Description | |-------|-------------| | `input` | Fired when the value changes | | `change` | Fired when the value changes and input loses focus | | `focus` | Fired when the input receives focus | | `blur` | Fired when the input loses focus | ### Event Handling ```javascript const input = document.querySelector('el-dm-input'); input.addEventListener('input', (event) => { console.log('Value:', event.target.value); }); ``` ## CSS Custom Properties | Property | Default | Description | |----------|---------|-------------| | `--input-padding-x` | `0.75rem` | Horizontal padding | | `--input-padding-y` | `0.5rem` | Vertical padding | | `--input-border-radius` | `0.375rem` | Border radius | | `--input-border-color` | `var(--color-outline)` | Border color | | `--input-focus-color` | `var(--color-primary)` | Focus ring color | | `--input-error-color` | `var(--color-error)` | Error state color | ## Accessibility - Labels are properly associated with inputs - Error messages are announced to screen readers - Focus states are clearly visible - Required fields are indicated with `aria-required`
Markdown rendering component with syntax highlighting and Mermaid support

import ComponentDemo from '../../../components/ComponentDemo.astro'; # Markdown The Markdown component renders markdown content with syntax highlighting, GitHub Flavored Markdown support, and optional Mermaid diagram rendering. ## Installation ```bash npm install @duskmoon-dev/el-markdown ``` For Mermaid diagram support (optional): ```bash npm install mermaid ``` ## Usage ```javascript import '@duskmoon-dev/el-markdown/register'; ``` ````html # Hello World This is **bold** and *italic* text. ```` ## Live Demo ## Properties | Property | Type | Default | Description | |----------|------|---------|-------------| | `content` | `string` | `''` | Markdown content to render (alternative to slot) | | `sanitize` | `boolean` | `true` | Sanitize HTML in markdown | | `highlight` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable syntax highlighting | | `mermaid` | `boolean` | `false` | Enable Mermaid diagram rendering | ## Content Methods ### Using Slot ````html # Heading Content goes here. ```` ### Using Property ```html ``` ### Using JavaScript ```javascript const md = document.querySelector('el-dm-markdown'); md.content = '# Dynamic Content\n\nUpdated via JavaScript.'; ``` ## Features ### GitHub Flavored Markdown The component supports GFM features: - Tables - Task lists - Strikethrough - Autolinks - Footnotes ````html | Feature | Supported | |---------|-----------| | Tables | ✅ | | Tasks | ✅ | - [x] Task 1 - [ ] Task 2 ```` ### Syntax Highlighting Code blocks are automatically highlighted: ````html ```javascript function greet(name) { console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`); } ``` ```` ### Mermaid Diagrams Enable Mermaid support for diagrams: ````html ```mermaid graph TD A[Start] --> B[Process] B --> C[End] ``` ```` ## Styling The markdown component applies styling through the `.markdown-body` class from `@duskmoon-dev/core`. ### CSS Custom Properties | Property | Description | |----------|-------------| | `--dm-markdown-font-family` | Font family for content | | `--dm-markdown-line-height` | Line height for paragraphs | | `--dm-markdown-code-bg` | Background color for code blocks | | `--dm-markdown-link-color` | Link color | ## Events | Event | Description | |-------|-------------| | `dm-rendered` | Fired after markdown is rendered | | `dm-error` | Fired if rendering fails | ### Event Handling ```javascript const md = document.querySelector('el-dm-markdown'); md.addEventListener('dm-rendered', (event) => { console.log('Markdown rendered:', event.detail); }); ``` ## Security By default, the component sanitizes HTML to prevent XSS attacks. You can disable this for trusted content: ````html
Custom HTML allowed
 ```` ⚠️ **Warning**: Only disable sanitization for trusted content sources. ## Accessibility - Semantic HTML is generated from markdown - Headings maintain proper hierarchy - Images require alt text - Links are keyboard navigable - Code blocks have proper language labels
Interactive button component with multiple variants and states

import ComponentDemo from '../../../components/ComponentDemo.astro';

# Button

The Button component provides an interactive button with multiple variants, sizes, and states.

## Installation

```bash
npm install @duskmoon-dev/el-button
```

## Usage

```javascript
import '@duskmoon-dev/el-button/register';
```

```html
<el-dm-button variant="primary">Click me</el-dm-button>
```

## Live Demo

<ComponentDemo title="Button Variants">
  <el-dm-button variant="primary">Primary</el-dm-button>
  <el-dm-button variant="secondary">Secondary</el-dm-button>
  <el-dm-button variant="outline">Outline</el-dm-button>
  <el-dm-button variant="ghost">Ghost</el-dm-button>
</ComponentDemo>

<script>
  import('@duskmoon-dev/el-button/register').then(m => m.register());
</script>

## Properties

| Property | Type | Default | Description |
|----------|------|---------|-------------|
| `variant` | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'outline' \| 'ghost'` | `'primary'` | Visual style of the button |
| `size` | `'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg'` | `'md'` | Size of the button |
| `disabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Disables the button |
| `loading` | `boolean` | `false` | Shows loading state |
| `type` | `'button' \| 'submit' \| 'reset'` | `'button'` | Button type attribute |

## Variants

### Primary

The primary variant is used for main actions.

```html
<el-dm-button variant="primary">Primary</el-dm-button>
```

### Secondary

The secondary variant is used for less prominent actions.

```html
<el-dm-button variant="secondary">Secondary</el-dm-button>
```

### Outline

The outline variant has a transparent background with a border.

```html
<el-dm-button variant="outline">Outline</el-dm-button>
```

### Ghost

The ghost variant is minimal, with no background or border.

```html
<el-dm-button variant="ghost">Ghost</el-dm-button>
```

## Sizes

<ComponentDemo title="Button Sizes">
  <el-dm-button size="sm">Small</el-dm-button>
  <el-dm-button size="md">Medium</el-dm-button>
  <el-dm-button size="lg">Large</el-dm-button>
</ComponentDemo>

```html
<el-dm-button size="sm">Small</el-dm-button>
<el-dm-button size="md">Medium</el-dm-button>
<el-dm-button size="lg">Large</el-dm-button>
```

## States

### Disabled

<ComponentDemo title="Disabled State">
  <el-dm-button disabled>Disabled</el-dm-button>
</ComponentDemo>

```html
<el-dm-button disabled>Disabled</el-dm-button>
```

### Loading

<ComponentDemo title="Loading State">
  <el-dm-button loading>Loading</el-dm-button>
</ComponentDemo>

```html
<el-dm-button loading>Loading</el-dm-button>
```

## Events

The button component emits standard DOM events:

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `click` | Fired when the button is clicked |
| `focus` | Fired when the button receives focus |
| `blur` | Fired when the button loses focus |

### Event Handling

```javascript
const button = document.querySelector('el-dm-button');
button.addEventListener('click', (event) => {
  console.log('Button clicked!');
});
```

## CSS Custom Properties

| Property | Default | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| `--btn-padding-x` | `1rem` | Horizontal padding |
| `--btn-padding-y` | `0.5rem` | Vertical padding |
| `--btn-border-radius` | `0.375rem` | Border radius |
| `--btn-font-weight` | `500` | Font weight |

## Accessibility

- The button uses native `<button>` element semantics
- Keyboard navigation is fully supported
- Focus states are clearly visible
- Disabled state is properly announced to screen readers
